contract.name: ddc_bucket
contract.description: DDC v2 Smart Contracts -- Orchestrate the network around clusters and buckets

docs: Create a new contract.
The caller will be admin of the contract.
name: new

docs: A bucket was created. The given account is its first owner and payer of resources.
events.name: BucketCreated

docs: Some amount of resources of a cluster were allocated to a bucket.
events.name: BucketAllocated

docs: The due costs of a bucket was settled from the bucket payer to the cluster.
events.name: BucketSettlePayment

docs: A new cluster was created.
events.name: ClusterCreated

docs: A vnode was re-assigned to new node.
events.name: ClusterNodeReplaced

docs: Some resources were reserved for the cluster from the nodes.
events.name: ClusterReserveResource

docs: The share of revenues of a cluster for a provider was distributed.
events.name: ClusterDistributeRevenues

docs: A new cluster was created.
events.name: CdnClusterCreated

docs: The respective share of revenues of a CDN cluster for a provider was distributed.
events.name: CdnClusterDistributeRevenues

docs: A node was created. The given account is its owner and recipient of revenues.
events.name: CdnNodeCreated

docs: A node was created. The given account is its owner and recipient of revenues.
events.name: NodeCreated

docs: Tokens were deposited on an account.
events.name: Deposit

docs: A permission was granted to the account.
events.name: GrantPermission

docs: A permission was revoked from the account.
events.name: RevokePermission

docs: Create a new bucket and return its `bucket_id`.
The caller will be its first owner and payer of resources.
`bucket_params` is configuration used by clients and nodes. See the [data structure of BucketParams](https://docs.cere.network/ddc/protocols/contract-params-schema)
The bucket can be connected to a single cluster (currently). Allocate cluster resources with the function `bucket_alloc_into_cluster`
name: bucket_create

docs: Change owner of the bucket
Provide the account of new owner
name: bucket_change_owner

docs: Allocate some resources of a cluster to a bucket.
The amount of resources is given per vnode (total resources will be `resource` times the number of vnodes).
name: bucket_alloc_into_cluster

docs: Settle the due costs of a bucket from its payer account to the cluster account.
name: bucket_settle_payment

docs: Change the `bucket_params`, which is configuration used by clients and nodes.
See the [data structure of BucketParams](https://docs.cere.network/ddc/protocols/contract-params-schema)
name: bucket_change_params

docs: Get the current status of a bucket.
name: bucket_get

docs: Iterate through all buckets.
The algorithm for paging is: start with `offset = 1` and `limit = 20`. The function returns a `(results, max_id)`. Call again with `offset += limit`, until `offset >= max_id`.
The optimal `limit` depends on the size of params.
The results can be filtered by owner. Note that paging must still be completed fully.
name: bucket_list

docs: Iterate through all buckets and return only those owned by owner
This method returns bucket struct, not the status
name: bucket_list_for_account

docs: Set availiablity of the bucket
name: bucket_set_availability

docs: Set max resource cap to be charged by CDN for public bucket
name: bucket_set_resource_cap

docs: Set permission for the reader of the bucket
name: get_bucket_writers

docs: Set permission for the writer of the bucket
name: bucket_set_writer_perm

docs: Revoke permission for the writer of the bucket
name: bucket_revoke_writer_perm

docs: Set permission for the reader of the bucket
name: get_bucket_readers

docs: Set permission for the reader of the bucket
name: bucket_set_reader_perm

docs: Revoke permission for the reader of the bucket
name: bucket_revoke_reader_perm

docs: Create a new cluster and return its `cluster_id`.
The caller will be its first manager.

The cluster is split in a number of vnodes. The vnodes are assigned to the given physical nodes in a round-robin. Only nodes of providers that trust the cluster manager can be used (see `node_trust_manager`). The assignment can be changed with the function `cluster_replace_node`.

`cluster_params` is configuration used by clients and nodes. In particular, this describes the semantics of vnodes. See the [data structure of ClusterParams](https://docs.cere.network/ddc/protocols/contract-params-schema)
name: cluster_create

docs: As manager, reserve more resources for the cluster from the free capacity of nodes.
The amount of resources is given per vnode (total resources will be `resource` times the number of vnodes).
name: cluster_reserve_resource

docs: As manager, re-assign a vnode to another physical node.
The cluster manager can only use nodes of providers that trust him (see `node_trust_manager`), or any nodes if he is also SuperAdmin.
name: cluster_replace_node

docs: Trigger the distribution of revenues from the cluster to the providers.
name: cluster_distribute_revenues

docs: Change the `cluster_params`, which is configuration used by clients and nodes.
See the [data structure of ClusterParams](https://docs.cere.network/ddc/protocols/contract-params-schema)
name: cluster_change_params

docs: Get the current status of a cluster.
name: cluster_get

docs: Iterate through all clusters.
The algorithm for paging is: start with `offset = 1` and `limit = 20`. The function returns a `(results, max_id)`. Call again with `offset += limit`, until `offset >= max_id`.
The optimal `limit` depends on the size of params.
The results can be filtered by manager. Note that paging must still be completed fully.
name: cluster_list

docs: Create a new cluster and return its `cluster_id`.
The caller will be its first manager.
The CDN node ids are provided, which will form a cluster.
name: cdn_cluster_create

docs: Set rate for streaming (price per gb)
name: cdn_set_rate

docs: Get rate for streaming (price per gb)
name: cdn_get_rate

docs: As validator, charge payments from users and allocate undistributed payments to CDN nodes.
As a result CDN cluster revenue increases, which can be distributed between CDN node providers via method cdn_cluster_distribute_revenues.
name: cdn_cluster_put_revenue

docs: Trigger the distribution of revenues from the cluster to the CDN node providers.
Anyone can call this method.
Undistributed payments will be trasnferred, CDN cluster revenue will decrease.
name: cdn_cluster_distribute_revenues

docs: Get the current status of a cluster.
name: cdn_cluster_get

docs: Iterate through all clusters.
The algorithm for paging is: start with `offset = 1` and `limit = 20`. The function returns a `(results, max_id)`. Call again with `offset += limit`, until `offset >= max_id`.
The optimal `limit` depends on the size of params.
The results can be filtered by manager. Note that paging must still be completed fully.
name: cdn_cluster_list

docs: CDN node operator sets the commit for current era.
name: set_commit

docs: Return the last commit submitted by CDN node operator
name: get_commit

docs: Return last era validated per CDN node
name: get_validated_commit

docs: Set the new configs for era
name: set_era

docs: Return current status of an era
name: get_era

docs: Return current era settings
name: get_era_settings

docs: As node provider, authorize a cluster manager to use his nodes.
name: cdn_node_trust_manager

docs: As node provider, revoke the authorization of a cluster manager to use his nodes.
name: cdn_node_distrust_manager

docs: Create a new node and return its `node_id`.
The caller will be its owner.

`node_params` is configuration used by clients and nodes. In particular, this contains the URL to the service. See the [data structure of NodeParams](https://docs.cere.network/ddc/protocols/contract-params-schema)
name: cdn_node_create

docs: Change the `node_params`, which is configuration used by clients and nodes.
See the [data structure of NodeParams](https://docs.cere.network/ddc/protocols/contract-params-schema)
name: cdn_node_change_params

docs: Get the current state of the cdn node
name: cdn_node_get

docs: Iterate through all nodes.
The algorithm for paging is: start with `offset = 1` and `limit = 20`. The function returns a `(results, max_id)`. Call again with `offset += limit`, until `offset >= max_id`.
The optimal `limit` depends on the size of params.
The results can be filtered by owner. Note that paging must still be completed fully.
name: cdn_node_list

docs: As node provider, authorize a cluster manager to use his nodes.
name: node_trust_manager

docs: As node provider, revoke the authorization of a cluster manager to use his nodes.
name: node_distrust_manager

docs: Create a new node and return its `node_id`.
The caller will be its owner.

`node_params` is configuration used by clients and nodes. In particular, this contains the URL to the service. See the [data structure of NodeParams](https://docs.cere.network/ddc/protocols/contract-params-schema)
name: node_create

docs: Change the `node_params`, which is configuration used by clients and nodes.
See the [data structure of NodeParams](https://docs.cere.network/ddc/protocols/contract-params-schema)
name: node_change_params

docs: Get the current status of a node.
name: node_get

docs: Iterate through all nodes.
The algorithm for paging is: start with `offset = 1` and `limit = 20`. The function returns a `(results, max_id)`. Call again with `offset += limit`, until `offset >= max_id`.
The optimal `limit` depends on the size of params.
The results can be filtered by owner. Note that paging must still be completed fully.
name: node_list

docs: Get the Fee Percentage Basis Points that will be charged by the protocol
name: get_fee_bp

docs: Return the last commit submitted by CDN node operator
name: set_fee_bp

docs: Return fees accumulated by the protocol
name: get_protocol_revenues

docs: Pay the revenues accumulated by the protocol
name: protocol_withdraw_revenues

docs: As user, deposit tokens on the account of the caller from the transaction value. This deposit
can be used to pay for the services to buckets of the account.
name: account_deposit

docs: As user, bond some amount of tokens from the withdrawable balance. These funds will be used to pay for CDN node service.
name: account_bond

docs: As user, unbond a specified amount of tokens. The tokens will be locked for some time, as defined by contract owner.
name: account_unbond

docs: As user, move the unbonded tokens back to withdrawable balance state.
This can be triggered after unbonded_timestamp
name: account_withdraw_unbonded

docs: Get the current status of an account.
name: account_get

docs: Get the current conversion rate between the native currency and an external currency (USD).
name: account_get_usd_per_cere

docs: As price oracle, set the current conversion rate between the native currency and an external currency (USD).
This requires the permission SetExchangeRate or SuperAdmin.
name: account_set_usd_per_cere

docs: Check whether the given account has the given permission currently,
or the SuperAdmin permission.
name: has_permission

docs: As SuperAdmin, grant any permission to any account.
name: admin_grant_permission

docs: As SuperAdmin, revoke any permission to any account.
name: admin_revoke_permission

docs: As SuperAdmin, withdraw the funds held in custody in this contract.
This is a temporary measure to allow migrating the funds to a new version of the contract.
name: admin_withdraw

docs: As SuperAdmin, set the network and cluster fee configuration.
name: admin_set_fee_config

docs: Get all Account IDs stored in the SC
name: get_accounts
